meanings.definition: A line of descent from an ancestor; a family tree.
meanings.sent1: My grandmother showed me our linages, tracing back to our great-great-grandparents.
meanings.sent2: The linages of the royal family were meticulously documented in the ancient castle.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally tripped over the linages chart and caused a family history disaster.
meanings.sent4: The linages of knowledge passed down through generations are like roots anchoring us.
meanings.sent5: Exploring our linages felt like unraveling a mystery novel filled with twists and turns.

meanings.definition: The number of lines of print on a page or in a book.
meanings.sent1: The book had a small font size, resulting in a high linages per page.
meanings.sent2: The linages in this newspaper are quite dense, making it challenging to read.
meanings.sent3: I lost count of the linages while trying to skim through the lengthy article.
meanings.sent4: The linages of text seemed to blur together as I struggled to focus on the words.
meanings.sent5: The linages of words on the page formed a sea of text, overwhelming my senses.
